Geography: Country of Origin Egypt, Upper Egypt; Thebes, Southern Asasif, Tomb of Meketre (TT 280, MMA 1101), Serdab, carpenter's shop, tool chest, MMA 1920
Medium: Bronze or copper alloy, wood, linen string
Dimensions: L. of handle 12 cm (4 3/4 in); w. of blade 3.1 cm (1 1/4 in)
Credit Line: Rogers Fund and Edward S. Harkness Gift, 1920
Provenance: Excavated by the Egyptian Expedition of the Metropolitan Museum of Art, 1920. Acquired by the Museum in the division of finds, 1920.
